description: Creates Amazon Q in Connect content. Before to calling this API, use StartContentUpload to upload an asset.

parameters.name: knowledgeBaseId
parameters.description: The identifier of the knowledge base. This should not be a QUICK_RESPONSES type knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the content. Each piece of content in a knowledge base must have a unique name. You can retrieve a piece of content using only its knowledge base and its name with the SearchContent API.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: A key/value map to store attributes without affecting tagging or recommendations. For example, when synchronizing data between an external system and Amazon Q in Connect, you can store an external version identifier as metadata to utilize for determining drift. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: uploadId
parameters.description: A pointer to the uploaded asset. This value is returned by StartContentUpload.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. If not provided, the Amazon Web Services SDK populates this field. For more information about idempotency, see Making retries safe with idempotent APIs. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.name: contentArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the content.

nested_items.name: knowledgeBaseArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the knowledge base.

nested_items.name: knowledgeBaseId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the knowledge base.

nested_items.name: revisionId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the content revision.

nested_items.name: contentType
nested_items.description: The media type of the content.

nested_items.name: urlExpiry
nested_items.description: The expiration time of the URL as an epoch timestamp.
